bibliographic_metadata.Title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Mineral Prospectivity Mapping
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Zixian Shi, Renguang Zuo, Bao Zhou

abstract: This study constructs a deep reinforcement learning (RL) framework for mineral prospectivity mapping, tested through a case study in northwest Hubei Province, China. The deep RL agent interacts with the environment to evaluate mineralization potential, outperforming traditional models like random forest and isolation forest. The results indicate strong spatial correlation with known gold deposits, providing valuable insights for future prospecting.

types: Geochemical data; various elements (Al2O3, CaO, Fe2O3, etc.)
dataset.scope: Training from labeled gold deposits to application in unlabeled areas

key_points: Deep reinforcement learning framework developed for mineral prospectivity mapping.
Case study conducted in northwest Hubei Province, China.
Deep RL outperformed traditional models like random forest and isolation forest.
High-potential areas identified correlate strongly with known gold deposits.
Framework effectively utilizes both labeled and unlabeled datasets.
